sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Western leaders discuss ramping up more weapons for Ukraine while Kyiv cracks down on corruption.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Serbia's president says his country would become a European pariah if they don't accept a Western-backed deal to normalize relations with Kosovo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: China has denied that a balloon being tracked by the Pentagon above the US is a spy device collecting data.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The few remaining residents of the Ukrainian city of Bakhmut are struggling to survive in the mists of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The front lines have not moved much in recent weeks and Kyiv is hoping that new weapons promised by the West will tip the balance in its favor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On the Kherson front, Ukrainian soldiers train while searching for a new way to cross the Dnipro River without suffering excessive casualties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The newly elected Czech president, a former NATO general, is calling on Ukraine allies to do more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And now the question of sending fighter jets has entered the debate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's easy to sort of get carried away and, you know, last week we gave tanks and what next can we promise?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There are things to promise next. And, you know, I've said in the Chamber of House of Commons I'm very open to examining all sorts of systems and not just jets to give Ukraine that assistance. But these things don't always happen overnight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Ukrainian authorities are cracking down on corruption within agencies managing funds intended to assist victims of war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In Odessa, several officials have been arrested for defrauding the state of nearly 175,000 euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Kyiv knows it needs to reassure donors that the money they give is going to the intended recipients.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A highly symbolic visit, showing off Europe's commitment to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ursula von der Leyen, the European Commission President in Kiev, once again meeting the Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But this time, she's not alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: No less than 15 European Commissioners have joined her for various meetings with the Ukrainian government. All this despite the fact that the country is still at war, meaning this gathering and these pictures will go down in history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But beyond the symbolism, President Zelensky wants the European Union to introduce more sanctions against Russia, as he thinks they're, quote, slowing down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We will introduce with our G7 partners an additional price cap on Russian petroleum products.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And by the 24th of February, exactly one year since the invasion started, we aim to have the 10th package of sanctions in place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Also on the table, how to promote the integration of Ukraine into the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But Kiev's hope for quick membership was frustrated, as there's no agreements between member states for a fast-track procedure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They say more work must be done.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine says it will continue fighting against corruption.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: While EU commissioners were meeting with Ukrainian ministers, the EU foreign affairs chief, Joseph Bor ministers, the EU Foreign Affairs Chief Joseph Borre was with the Prime Minister, promising to double the number of Ukrainian soldiers to be trained, as well as campaigning to deactivate mines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On Friday, the visit continues with an EU-Ukraine summit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Our Sasha Vakuliny has more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian authorities insisted that the EU-Ukraine summit should take place here in Kyiv and not in Brussels. They wanted the delegation of senior EU officials to see how the country is operating, how they're introducing measures and requirements, whilst at the same time defending itself for almost one year now, something that that clear certainly believes deserves the EU membership Sasha Makulina Euronews Kosovo has signaled that it's willing to create an association of five Serb

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: majority municipalities in the north of the country in order to unblock talks with Belgrade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Critics say it could give Serbia a permanent hand in Kosovo's politics, but it's a key part of a 2013 deal to eventually normalize relations between the two countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Serbia's president, Aleksandar Vucic, has urged lawmakers in Belgrade to accept the diplomatic moves. Would we become a European pariah?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Yes, we would. Completely isolated. No one would talk to us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We would not have any access to funds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: You cannot function in the modern world alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: However, Serbian nationalists consider any move towards the recognition of Kosovo's independence unacceptable and have made their anger known to Vucic in parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Several dozen people also demonstrated in Belgrade against any political understanding being struck with Pristina.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Grim times for big tech. Apple has just reported a 5% drop in sales for the final months of 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The company's first quarterly decline in almost four years reflects the impact of Covid restrictions in Chinese factories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It coincides with disappointing results for the same period for Google.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Parent company Alphabet's profit of 13.6 billion dollars, or 12.4 billion euros, was below its earnings for the same period last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There was better news for Amazon, with its revenues exceeding expectations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But the online retail platform has already announced thousands of job cuts and has given a cautious sales forecast for the current quarter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Chinese Foreign Ministry has denied that a balloon spotted in US airspace is collecting sensitive information. The American ministry has denied that a balloon spotted in U.S. airspace is collecting sensitive information.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Instead, they claimed it is a civilian airship collecting meteorological data and that it had accidentally strayed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's recently been spotted over western states and forced a brief precautionary closure of an airport in the city of Billings, Montana.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: U.S. defense officials say they're tracking the object but don't plan to shoot it down to avoid injuring people on the ground.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: China has launched a number of satellites which Washington believes are intended to spy on the US. However, analysts say the balloon is unlikely to provide any additional benefit to Chinese intelligence gathering.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But the incident does further raise tensions between the two countries ahead of a reported visit by Secretary of State Antony Blinken to Beijing this weekend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The trip following on from his Middle East tour has not been formally announced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: However it is said to be aimed at finding common ground amid a host of long-standing diplomatic conflicts.
